Package camzup.pfriendly

Class PMatAux

java.lang.Object
camzup.pfriendly.PMatAux
public abstract class PMatAux
extends java.lang.Object
The PMatrix class is marked final and hence cannot be extended and augmented. Due to its use in PGraphicsOpenGL it cannot be ignored. This class stores static functions which alter and/or supplement PMatrix functions.

  • Constructor Summary

  • Method Details

    • det3x3

      public static float det3x3​(float t00, float t01, float t02, float t10, float t11, float t12, float t20, float t21, float t22)
      Helper function for inverting a PMatrix3D. Finds the determinant for a 3x3 section of a 4x4 matrix.
      Parameters:
      t00 - row 0, column 0
      t01 - row 0, column 1
      t02 - row 0, column 2
      t10 - row 1, column 0
      t11 - row 1, column 1
      t12 - row 1, column 2
      t20 - row 2, column 0
      t21 - row 2, column 1
      t22 - row 2, column 2
      Returns:
      the determinant

    • frustum

      public static PMatrix3D frustum​(float left, float right, float bottom, float top, float near, float far)
      Creates a view frustum given the edges of the view port.
      Parameters:
      left - the left edge of the window
      right - the right edge of the window
      bottom - the bottom edge of the window
      top - the top edge of the window
      near - the near clip plane
      far - the far clip plane
      Returns:
      the view frustum

    • frustum

      public static PMatrix3D frustum​(float left, float right, float bottom, float top, float near, float far, PMatrix3D target)
      Creates a view frustum given the edges of the view port.
      Parameters:
      left - the left edge of the window
      right - the right edge of the window
      bottom - the bottom edge of the window
      top - the top edge of the window
      near - the near clip plane
      far - the far clip plane
      target - the output matrix
      Returns:
      the view frustum

    • invert

      public static PMatrix3D invert​(PMatrix3D m, PMatrix3D target)
      Inverts the input matrix. This is an expensive operation, and so matrix inverses should be cached when needed.
      Parameters:
      m - the matrix
      target - the output matrix
      Returns:
      the inverted matrix
      See Also:
      det3x3(float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float), PMatrix3D.determinant()

    • mul

      public static PMatrix3D mul​(PMatrix3D a, PMatrix3D b)
      Multiplies two matrices together. Matrix multiplication is not commutative, so the PMatrix3D class calls in-place multiplication "apply" and "preApply."
      Parameters:
      a - the left operand
      b - the right operand
      Returns:
      the product
      See Also:
      PMatrix3D.apply(PMatrix3D), PMatrix3D.preApply(PMatrix3D)

    • mul

      public static PMatrix3D mul​(PMatrix3D a, PMatrix3D b, PMatrix3D target)
      Multiplies two matrices together. Matrix multiplication is not commutative, so the PMatrix3D class calls in-place multiplication "apply" and "preApply."
      Parameters:
      a - the left operand
      b - the right operand
      target - the output matrix
      Returns:
      the product
      See Also:
      PMatrix3D.apply(PMatrix3D), PMatrix3D.preApply(PMatrix3D)

    • mul

      public static Vec4 mul​(PMatrix3D m, Vec4 v, Vec4 target)
      Multiplies a matrix with a four dimensional vector. This is useful when the w component needs to be stored for diagnostic purposes (rather than demoting the vector to a 3D point).
      Parameters:
      m - the matrix
      v - the input vector
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the product

    • mulPoint

      public static PVector mulPoint​(PMatrix3D m, PVector v)
      Multiplies a matrix with a three dimensional point, where its implicit fourth coordinate, w, is 1.0 .
      Parameters:
      m - the matrix
      v - the input vector
      Returns:
      the product

    • orthographic

      public static PMatrix3D orthographic​(float left, float right, float bottom, float top, float near, float far)
      Creates an orthographic projection matrix, where objects maintain their size regardless of distance from the camera.
      Parameters:
      left - the left edge of the window
      right - the right edge of the window
      bottom - the bottom edge of the window
      top - the top edge of the window
      near - the near clip plane
      far - the far clip plane
      Returns:
      the orthographic projection

      top - the top edge of the window

    • perspective

      public static PMatrix3D perspective​(float fov, float aspect, float near, float far)
      Creates a perspective projection matrix, where objects nearer to the camera appear larger than objects distant from the camera.
      Parameters:
      fov - the field of view
      aspect - the aspect ratio, width over height
      near - the near clip plane
      far - the far clip plane
      Returns:
      the perspective projection

    • perspective

      public static PMatrix3D perspective​(float fov, float aspect, float near, float far, PMatrix3D target)
      Creates a perspective projection matrix, where objects nearer to the camera appear larger than objects distant from the camera.
      Parameters:
      fov - the field of view
      aspect - the aspect ratio, width over height
      near - the near clip plane
      far - the far clip plane
      target - the output matrix
      Returns:
      the perspective projection

    • rotate

      public static PMatrix3D rotate​(Quaternion q)
      Rotates a matrix by a quaternion in place.
      Parameters:
      q - the quaternion
      Returns:
      the matrix

    • rotate

      public static PMatrix3D rotate​(Quaternion q, PMatrix3D target)
      Rotates a matrix by a quaternion in place. Does so by converting the quaternion to a matrix, then multiplying the input matrix and the conversion.
      Parameters:
      q - the quaternion
      target - the output matrix
      Returns:
      the matrix

    • rotateInv

      public static PMatrix3D rotateInv​(Quaternion q, PMatrix3D target)
      Inverse-rotates a matrix by a quaternion in place. Does so by inverting the matrix, converting it to a matrix, then multiplying the conversion and the input matrix. (I.e., unlike rotation, the quaternion is the left hand opernd.)
      Parameters:
      q - the quaternion
      target - the output matrix
      Returns:
      the matrix

    • rotateX

      public static PMatrix3D rotateX​(float radians)
      PMatrix3D's instance methods for rotating around orthonormal axes defer to rotation about an arbitrary axis. This is not necessary for rotate X.
      Parameters:
      radians - the angle in radians
      Returns:
      the rotation matrix

    • rotateX

      public static PMatrix3D rotateX​(float radians, PMatrix3D target)
      PMatrix3D's instance methods for rotating around orthonormal axes defer to rotation about an arbitrary axis. This is not necessary for rotate X.
      Parameters:
      radians - the angle in radians
      target - the matrix
      Returns:
      the mutated matrix
